Another Leap Forward For Submission Standards

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Iberson-Hurst
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The FDA recommends CDISC as the method of submitting clinical trial data.

X.T: The CDISC Business Case for Industry Data Standards

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Edward D. Helton
Rebecca Daniels Kush
Carol Rozwell
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After claiming that CDISC can save 30% of the costs of a clinical trial, they explain that using CDISC earlier in the test lifecycle results in larger savings. They also speak (once again…) about the SDTM/AdAM FDA pilot study.

X.T: Using CDISC Standards to Address Information Sharing and Interoperability Needs of Academic Research Centers

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Christopher G. Chute
Edward D. Helton
Rebecca Daniels Kush
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The first part is a much-too-fast presentation of the standardisation efforts and the needs to go further. The second part deals with CDISC and, in particular, BRIDG, Protocol Representation (i.e. protocol metadata), Terminology, and eSource Data Interchange.

X.T: CDISC's Becky Kush on Standards Adoption - Part 1

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An interview of Ann Neuer: the current status of CDISC, CDASH…

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ann Neuer
ARTICLE.COMMENT: … BRIDG and the CFR/EHR integration.

X.T: CDISC Standards Take Hold, EDC Often a Veneer

ARTICLE.COMMENT: CDISC is mature, but EDC vendors use it more as a selling argument than really exploiting it.

X.T: Q. When is the ODM not the ODM? A. When it uses vendor extensions.
